Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment and internal flight alternative
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed fear of persecution by FARC; RPD found inconsistencies in testimony and assumed safety in Bogota
Decision_Outcome: RPD denied refugee status based on credibility concerns and internal flight alternative
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn RPD decision
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; RPD decision overturned
Defendant_Behavior: RPD dismissed threats due to lack of evidence and questioned credibility
Grounds_for_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution by FARC
Assessment_Factor: Credibility, internal flight alternative, risk of persecution
Credibility_Assessment: RPD found contradictions in Applicant's testimony
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Evidence_Assessed: Threats from FARC, history of being tracked, urban presence of FARC
Relief_Sought: Overturning of RPD decision and recognition as refugee
Governing_Rule: A Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to consider FARC's urban capabilities and Applicant's tracking history
Outcome: RPD decision set aside, case remitted for re-determination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to persecution by FARC
Cause_Description: Applicant's refugee claim was denied by RPD citing credibility issues and existence of an internal flight alternative
Evidence_Handling: RPD dismissed threats due to lack of corroborating evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions regarding refugee eligibility and procedural fairness
Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroboration, dismissal of subjective fear without proper analysis
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of evidence on FARCâ€™s reach and personal targeting
Decision_Rationale: RPD unreasonably assessed credibility and failed to properly evaluate internal flight alternative
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider relevant evidence on urban FARC activities and individualized risk
